definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: Tuotuo flapped ears and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 脱脱耷拉着耳朵，走开了。

sentences.english: His legs were sticking out as they carried him past me.
sentences.chinese: 当他们抬着他经过我的时候，他的腿耷拉在外面。

sentences.english: A dog limped below, ears flat, tail between its legs.
sentences.chinese: 一只狗耷拉着耳朵，夹着尾巴在下面一瘸一拐地走。

sentences.english: He sat down heavily, his shoulders drooping, his arms falling between his outspread legs.
sentences.chinese: 他颓然坐下，肩膀耷拉着，双臂垂在叉开的。

sentences.english: They went out into the open country and sat down, and the two pulled sorrowful faces.
sentences.chinese: 他们来到外面的开阔地坐下，那两个耷拉着苦瓜脸。

sentences.english: It was then that I noticed the image of a puppy with floppy ears beside the Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 这时我才注意到汉字旁边有一只耷拉着耳朵的小狗像。

sentences.english: When I punted him in the head, he went limp and his hands fell to the concrete.
sentences.chinese: 我他的头上猛踢了脚，他就蔫了，手耷拉到水泥地面。

sentences.english: I remember how his shoulders slumped and his head hung down as he told me about his failure.
sentences.chinese: 我至今还记得他耷拉着肩膀，垂着头的失望表情。

sentences.english: The main-sail hung drooped like a banner.
sentences.chinese: 主帆耷拉着，像一面旗帜。

sentences.english: So whoever said we were poor?
sentences.chinese: 谁说过我们穷的滴沥耷拉？

sentences.english: Her hat slouched down to her cheek.
Mrs. McCaskey arose heavily, and went toward the dish closet, with the corners of her mouth drawn down.
sentences.chinese: 麦卡斯基夫人缓缓地站起来，嘴角耷拉着往碗柜走去。

sentences.english: He sat slumped in his chair with his head down.
sentences.chinese: 他颓唐地坐在椅中，耷拉着脑袋。

sentences.english: Its ears hung down , big enough to cover half its face.
sentences.chinese: 它两耳耷拉着，大得能盖住半边脸。

sentences.english: Ears hanging as on a hound, or semi-prick ears are disqualifications .
sentences.chinese: 耳朵象猎犬那样耷拉着或半立耳都属于失格。

sentences.english: I slouched in a nearby chair and saw all of it.
sentences.chinese: 我耷拉在附近一把椅子上看着这一切。

definition: to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
